website_summaries.verdict: Adjustable staple depth and a number of other features give this top-ranked stapler a professional feel.
pros: Low nail lockout prevents dry firing
Requires no oil, so you won't stain what you're trying to staple
Comes with fasteners, air fitting, and carrying case
cons: Some quality issues have been reported, from breaking parts to problems getting the staples to load

customer_reviews.title: Solid Nailer
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this tool is that it is made for 7/32" wide staples when the most common size is 1/4". However, I think this is a moot point because I did purchase and successfully fire 1/4" wide staples with no problem at all. I've nailed hundreds of staples so far without a misfire.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Primary use is putting bee hive frames together and initial tacking of hive boxes prior to nailing. I use Bostitch staples exclusively and have not had one failure or jam to date. I really like the oil free design. I just attach the airhose and off I go.
customer_reviews.author: notsofunny

customer_reviews.title: Easy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this stapler to complete a DIY staple up in-floor heat job. I have a shallow, dirt floor crawlspace and have to shoot ~15,000 staples. I'm about 1/3 of the way through the job and haven't had a single problem. No jams (as some others report) and very easy to reload in cramped quarters. this gun has been rolled around in the dirt due to the confine space and is still functioning well. I cannot believe what this job would have been without it. I bought the "Spot Nails Spot Nails 1804PG 1/2-inch Leg Staples Similar to Bostitch SX5035 series 7/32-inch Crown 5,000 per Box" and they work perfectly, much cheaper than the Bostitch Staples.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Watch your air pressure!
customer_reviews.text: We used these staplers to apply cedar shingles. If the pressure exceeds, about 80 lbs, the hammer breaks. The manual indicates higher pressures in excess of a 100 lbs is OK. If we maintained the pressure less than 80 lbs, less problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Great stapler with very useful features.
customer_reviews.text: The soft tip makes running stables near an edge much easier. So very useful when stapling into 1/2” plywood, which I do a lot for making drawers with 1/4” bottoms. Also, the depth gauge works quite well so I’m not driving staples through that thin sheet of plywood. And when doing a lot stapling, the auto-trigger works to speed things up. So great little stapler with all the needed features.
customer_reviews.author: GfSarkiss

customer_reviews.title: Narrow crown is good, but has a minor flaw
customer_reviews.text: The stapler uses slightly narrower crowns than the standard 1/4". This makes it more appropriate for smaller work in my mind. One flaw is that it did not fire consistently in single shot mode. It works flawlessly in multiple shot mode. I simply keep it in that mode and pull the trigger one shot at a time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kellman

customer_reviews.title: Great can’t do without tool!
customer_reviews.text: Staples are far superior to brads and this stapler has been found to get the job done. This is the second one I’ve owned over the last 20 years or so. The other one didn’t break; I just can’t find it.
customer_reviews.author: misterandy

customer_reviews.title: The most for your $
customer_reviews.text: This crown stapler is the best I have ever seen! it loads really easy and the extra features. such as removable ambi belt hook make this a real buy for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Doorgunner1969

customer_reviews.title: Product Features Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Product Features on product page lists: "Swivel air fitting with internal filter improves manoeuvrability ." Product came with standard fitting.
customer_reviews.author: T. Thom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect function. No failures stapling steel corner bead to steel studs
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to see this stapler misfire, I spent the weekend using it to staple metal bullnose corner bead to metal studs through 5/8” sheet rock Perfect function.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: no oil never miss fires
customer_reviews.text: this is a perfect gun never mis fires light easy to use and no need to oil highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: gareth.cairns

customer_reviews.title: I give this tool a solid 5 stars and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made and thought out tool. While it is designed specifically for the 5.6 mm crown staples, I have been shooting the standard 6.3 MM crown staples through it without any issues whatsoever. I do not know how they came up with the sizing, but the quarter inch or 6.3mm crown staples have a smaller outside dimension that causes them to fit slightly looser in the mag well but does not affect the operation. I give this tool a solid 5 stars and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good stapler
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I've only had this particular item for a few weeks now, but it seems about as well made as several of its predecessor models that I have used for many years. Also like its predecessors I'm fairly certain that it will not be very tolerant of abuse. So be kind to it and it will last you.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy, high quality product. Works very well. Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy, high quality product. Works very well. Good buy
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty gun, but it was supposed to have a swivel fitting...it does not...WHY!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy duty gun, but it was supposed to have a swivel fitting...it does not...WHY!!
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Great stapler
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and I put it to use immediately. Not too heavy and works just fine. Can adjust the depth that staple goes into the wood. Fired 200-250 without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: PhillieBaby

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Have been stapling up 1800 sqft of Knotty Alder tongue and groove 1" x 4.5" ceiling lumber. This gun has not misfired of failed, even once. Using 7/16th by 1.5" staples, the gun will drive them well into the material, no heads left sticking out. The safety lock prevents accidential trigger pulls, it is a very safe tool for the "Do it yourselfers" out there. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: W. M. Bresnahan

customer_reviews.title: The trigger is a bit tricky. If you don't ...
customer_reviews.text: The trigger is a bit tricky. If you don't push the stapler against the work firmly, the trigger won't fire. Could be a user problem.
customer_reviews.author: dlary9890

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Leaked air right out of the box plus inconsistent firing and not easy to see do to angle required for safety. Returning it for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Great Stapler
customer_reviews.text: History: I've been in the building trade all my life and have extensive experience with most tools. Review: This is a great stapler. Quick change trigger, quick turn depth gauge, and hook to hold it on your belt while working. It even has a built in pencil sharpener- funny, but helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great staple gun for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Was building a sunroom when my 15 year old Bostitch staple guns died. Got on Amazon to find replacements an was shocked that the prices were half what the local store wanted for them. Was very pleased when they came in, brand new in the case. Finished the sunroom and will probably have the staple guns for another 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Has run pretty well putting in over 6000 1 1/2" staples to ...
customer_reviews.text: Has run pretty well putting in over 6000 1 1/2" staples to hold down 1/4" under-layment. There were several dozen double staples and a few time it would not fire without reloading the staples. All staples used were Bostitch.
customer_reviews.author: Rusticman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far , I've noticed review on some products I think sometimes we don't take the time to read enough. This stapler is great it help us out saved time , Bostitch has been known for its quality of there brand .
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Underlayment
customer_reviews.text: Mainly use it for stapling down underlayment. 10,000+ staples later and it still holds depth setting.
customer_reviews.author: Deb C.

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I installed a tongue and groove porch ceiling with this tool. It was my first job using a stapler and it performed perfectly. Over 300 staples installed without a jam. I have many other Bostitch air tools and highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Mitch L

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product, used it as soon as I got it, nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a high volume staple project
customer_reviews.text: This staple gun has a good balance, and is reasonably light to save your arm/wrist over a long day of stapling. If you need a stapler that has a fast-fire operation, and allows for quick staple loading then this should be given consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Goodyt

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works ok most of the time but misfires from time to time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: This gun is amazing. Starting at the swivel air connection right on to the fact that it knows when it's out of staples. I'm using this guy for a 1x6 knotty pine ceiling firing 1 1⁄2" staples. A finishing nail in the tongue is to thin and pulls right thru.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Great Stapler
customer_reviews.text: Its a Bostich! Of course it works great. No issues at all. Built to last and last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: SX1838 stapler
customer_reviews.text: I got this stapler to specifically install Masonite on the walls of my garage. It worked great. Never a single jam or issue. I have bought other Bostitch reconditioned tools. They are wonderful values
customer_reviews.author: mrrdeac

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Ihave for a few years a bostich wire nailer that has performed well.So decided to stick with B for a stapler. Well constructed lite weight. Performed uphostlery tasks flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: C. L. F.

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it...nice sale price!!
customer_reviews.text: very well made, love the hook! I don't know how long 'oil less' designs live but otherwise you can't go wrong here, esp if u buy the Eagle staples on amazon as well, no one else comes close.
customer_reviews.author: JohnyMac

customer_reviews.title: Another good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This worked out very well. It was exactly what was needed since the repair kits are no longer available for my older stapler.
customer_reviews.author: SNG

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: So far its good. Love the ability to change the depth of staples.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Chavis

customer_reviews.title: Narrow crown stapler
customer_reviews.text: Works the way its suppose to, no jams so far.I like the fact that its oil less.I have more Bostitch product and have not had very many problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: DR. BOB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, does exactly what we want and the auto ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, does exactly what we want and the auto feature makes puting down underlayment for sheet vinyl so much faster than before
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Everything as described. Depth setting dial does not seem ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything as described. Depth setting dial does not seem to be very accurate, but other than that I'm really liking this staple gun.
customer_reviews.author: rdemmin2

customer_reviews.title: Great Stapler
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool, good quality. Trouble free operation after four months of use. Staple construction is strong and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived and worked very well! Thank you for the service!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Harris

customer_reviews.title: A must for DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: This one completed my set of Bostitch staplers. They make a great product. Great for any contractor or amazing for the DIY projects since you don't need a large compressor to use it. Any small (dependable brand) compressor will do fine. I use the Bostitch wafer compressor that Iv'e had for years. Just be sure to use a good air tool oil from time to time and only a few drops is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: P. Coe

customer_reviews.title: good product, poor reliability
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the stapler in nov 2010 to install a beadboard ceiling and trim in a small house. Stapler is now in for service for the 3rd time, after less then 5000 staples. The first time the piston jammed in the cylinder, the last 2 times the piston won't retract far enough to catch a staple.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Heck

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with this Stapler.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this stapler new from Amazon (not a different merchant) for a remodel project. Shipping was fast with my Prime account. I went through 1000 staples in about an hour and didn't have a single jam. It's my first stapler/tool gun so I didn't know much about them before ordering.The tool seems solid and well built. Setup was easy, just adjust the staple depth and off you go. The swivel air connector is really nice. I'm looking forward to using it on my next project.
customer_reviews.author: CER

customer_reviews.title: This tool is a must for your tool collection!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is terrific for applying screen molding and other thin moldings that nails would otherwise pull through. It's well built, light weight, and works flawlessly right out of the box. I honestly can't believe that I lived so long without this little handy dandy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer!

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Use it for putting my bee hives together. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I could not do without it so I ordered one just like it.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these stolen. I could not do without it so I ordered one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron LaFeber

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my tool box
customer_reviews.text: The SX1838K was easier to use in terms of putting the staples exactly where I wanted them and particularly for providing good countersinking of the fasteners. It also does not require oiling, which avoids the possibility of staining the work. I use the stapler in my home shop for a variety of day to day fastening needs.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: 18 gauge stapler
customer_reviews.text: stapler worked for 5 staples and quit,i had to tear the gun down and clean the cylinder and then it has been working good so far.other than that i am happy with the stapler.
customer_reviews.author: Lorrie Burtovoy

customer_reviews.title: Buy this NOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tool. No dry fires. Superior hold. In thinner materials take care and aim well as longer staples may deflect and pop out of the side of your piece (however this is a problem for all mechanical fastening). I don’t remember what life was like before this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Epicurus

customer_reviews.title: Alright gun but pins aren't going in all the time.
customer_reviews.text: I rated this lower because this a good stapler but I have been having some problems. I just bought it and even though I have sufficient pressure (very large air tank in the shop) the pins don't go into the wood properly. My other gun from another company works perfectly. Other than the crucial problem, the case and gun look great and were brand new. Perhaps mine is defective?
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a versatile tool that can be used for many tasks. Smooth operation and quality construction. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: jke

customer_reviews.title: Nice stapler
customer_reviews.text: I got this stapler to reinforce joints for custom picture frames. The stapler is powerful, easy to use and is great for the job intended. I use the 1/2 in leg staples. Just need to make sure the staple is centered in the joint.
customer_reviews.author: N. M. M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband was thrilled and it works perfectly we are very satidfied
customer_reviews.author: Happy mommy

customer_reviews.title: Bostitch SX1838K 18 Gauge Narrow Crown Stapler
customer_reviews.text: I like the stapler alot. Using it for wood flooring installation. While not configured for installing wood flooring, it was jury-rigged to do so and did an acceptable job. Having more floors to do, will make a jig to work better. I have used the stapler in another application and it worked great. It is relatively small and easy to handle. I did not give this stapler 5-stars because of Amazon's delivery. For an "in stock" item, it took nearly a week to get it even though it was eventually shipped from a neighboring state. Unacceptable in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: G. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Puts a smile on my husbands face every time he uses it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband for christmas. He loves it. Has a lot of power, works great. He hasn't stop talking about what a great tool this is.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon R

customer_reviews.title: excellent stapler.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a compressor from another company.....they provided 3 different types of staplers....none worked well so we purchased the Bostitch. Should have bought Bostitch in the first place....excellent stapler.
customer_reviews.author: lambert9683

customer_reviews.title: great product for cedar shingle siding project
customer_reviews.text: Received the stapler on time and happy with the quality. Have been finishing my home with cedar siding and it the perfect fit to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hope it last longer than previous one i bought two years ago
customer_reviews.author: Zane Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lightweight tool
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a variety of air-actuated nail guns over the years but this is my first stapler. It's very light, so it's easy to use. Heavier guns take more effort to move so your accuracy suffers. Not so with this machine. I found the depth setting to be very precise - So much so you'll find yourself modifying the setting as you change materials. It's a nice machine and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Carnathan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lot of new features that my old stapler didn't have, safety mode, depth control, oiless and belt hook
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Singletary

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a stapler and received a brad nailer. I'm a little afraid to try again...
customer_reviews.author: Barb F.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't load staples
customer_reviews.text: I tried to load the staples many times, it is not loading ! the design of the magazine is not good
customer_reviews.author: shemairi

product_meta.title: BOSTITCH Crown Stapler, Narrow, 18GA (SX1838K)
product_meta.description:
BOSTITCH SX1838K 18-Gauge Narrow-Crown Stapler

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Bostitch SX1838K 18GA Narrow Crown Finish Stapler is designed for the professional driving 7/32 In. narrow crown staples from 1/2 In. to 1-1/2 In. in length. Along with our other small-body finish tools, this tool is made with lightweight magnesium and has a tough new industrial design. The oil-free engine requires no maintenance and prevents stains on work surfaces, while the swivel air fitting with filtered air inlet increases maneuverability and improves engine durability. The selectable trigger system allows for easy conversion between sequential or contact modes. Additionally, the SX1838K features a dial-a-depth control for quick countersinking adjustments and a low fastener lockout that prevents dry fire and alerts the user when it's time to reload. The ultra-quiet rear exhaust directs air away from the user and the reversable belt hook with integrated pencil sharpener allows for ultimate convenience on the job site. The SX1838K is great for finsh, trim, soffits, cabinetry, furniture, an any other stapling function you can dream up! Kit includes: Stapler and durable carry case.
feature_bullets: TOOL-FREE SELECTABLE TRIGGER SYSTEM: For sequential or contact operation.
DIAL-A-DEPTH(TM) CONTROL: For precise countersinking of staples.
LOW NAIL LOCKOUT: Prevents dry firing.
KIT INCLUDES: Finish Stapler, 1/4" Air Fitting and Carrying Case.

specifications.Included Components: Finish Stapler, 1/4" Air Fitting and Carrying Case.
